text:
e="preserve">Margaret L. "Peg" Murray (February 14, 1924 – November 29, 2020) was an American actress. She was born in Denver, Colorado. She won a Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actress in a Musical for her performance as the villain "Fräulein Kost" in the original Broadway production of "Cabaret" (1966).
Murray died on November 29, 2020 in Southold, New York at the age of 96.

annotations.surface_form: Best Performance by a Featured Actress in a Musical
